BAHRAIN Telegrams: Airways, GPH/2/2020 23rd September,1938 The Political Agent BAHRAIN. Dear Sir, We have been requested by our Station Superintendent at Sharjah to inform you of the circumstances of the delay in delivery to the Political Resident of a consignment of freight which you despatched from Sharjah recently. The consignment arrived in Karachi on the 29 th August and was taken to the Bristol Hotel, where Mr. Weightman was staying, by one of our IV 1 staff on the following day. Our representative was informed that Mr. Weightman was ill and could not see him and that Mr. Croning, his assistant, was not in the hotel at the time. He therefore handed the freight over to Mr. Wysman, the proprietor of the hotel, and requested him to deliver it to Mr. Weightman® Yours faithfully, for Imperial Jlirways Ltd. Station Superintendent-19/1. Political Agency, Bahrain, the 26th September 1938 To The Station Superintendent, Imperial Airways Limited Bahrain. Dear Sir, With reference to your letter No. GPH/2/2020, dated the 23rd September 1938, I write to point out that the facts stated in your letter are not entirely correct. The consignment in question left Sharjah at noon on the 28th August and presumably arrived at Karachi very early on the morning of the 29th; at least early enough to allow of its delivery the same day* It was not delivered on the 29th August nor on the 30th but was taken to the Bristol Hotel on the evening of the 31st August, the total time expended between its departure from Sharjah and its delivery in Karachi being three days, five and a half hours. titleInfo.title: 'File 19/1 III Tours of Political Agent, Bahrain'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in the file are arranged chronologically. There are notes at the end of the file, on folios 185-197. The notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file; they give brief description of the correspondence with a number in blue and red crayon, which refers back to that correspondence in the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 198; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 2-170 and a mixed foliation/pagination sequence between ff 186-191; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains telegrams and correspondence regarding arrangements and expenses for visits of the Political Agent and the Officiating Political Agent at Bahrain (Captain John Baron Howes) to Basra, Qatar, Abu Dhabi, Sharjah, Dubai, Ras al Khaimah; and programmes of tours of Bahrain by the Political Officer, Trucial Coast in 1944.The principal correspondents are: Imperial Airways Limited; the Senior Naval Officer in the Persian Gulf; the Residency Agent at Sharjah; the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; and the Political Agent at Bahrain.There are some documents in Arabic with English translation within the file, correspondence with the Residency Agent at Sharjah; and copies of letters from Shaikh Shakhbut bin Sultan, Ruler of Abu Dhabi; Shaikh Abdullah bin Jasim Al Thani, Ruler of Qatar; and his Secretary, Ṣāliḥ bin Sulaiman Āl Māni'.
